column2: neveragain, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had total hysterectomy 4 months ago.  About 6 weeks ago, began severe sweating, not just flashes.  My gynocologist had me try a low dose of prempro and wean myself off effexor after a month.  Sweating improved, but rest of my health went downhill.  Extreme shortness of breath started a week ago along with light headediness,  fatigue, coughing, watery eyes and other allergy symptoms, all quiet severe.  Unable to see my gynocologist until next week.  So today went to see my family practitioner,  after calling in tears, that i needed help.  Honestly thought i was either having a heart attack or going crazy.  After chest xray and bloodwork (which of course do not have results just yet), he said he was concerned about a pulmonary embolism.   That scares me.  But i am now convincing myself, until further testing, that its a reaction to the prempro!  Doctor told me to quit it immediately and start back on my effexor, which helps with anxiety.  And trust me, I am definitely anxious after this past week.  Things just sort of came to a head today.  Im hoping for better days soon, sweating or not.  Glad to hear other ladies have good results with prempro.  But to me, it was a nightmare.  Actually, lying in bed writing this because I'm still feeling pretty rough.  Please tomorrow be better!

column2: autumnwolf, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: While taking Prempro, I feel the way I did before menopause.  No hot flashes, night sweats, I feel very good, or should I say I feel NORMAL again!  Ive been on it for ten years, and I am afraid to stop taking it.

column2: prempro, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has worked extremely well for me, and it being such a low dose,I feel a bit "safer".

column2: coleen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ok just started this drug. so far no side effects. will get back to u in one week.

column2: mamadonna, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 55 years old. I was experiencing extreme hot flashes particlarly at night. Doctor put me on this medication. Within 1 week saw a significant decrease in hot flashes BUT wieght gain, moodiness, cramping started. Went to every other day and seemed to be doing OK until I got a period! After speaking with the nurse, I have stopped taking the medication. May consider herbal treatment if the hot flashes return.

column2: sjenki, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was a little nervous, having read the possible side affects, but I am feeling so much better it is unreal! No night sweats, and my skin is doing a age reversal, which is a pleasant surprise. Just get you check ups and enjoy the relief!

column2: patty51, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on the prempro for about eight years. The past three weeks I have been waking up at 3am with hot flashes and soaked Why isn't the medication working anymore.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
mean mama, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't know how I am supposed to feel, my moods are up and down. I'm still having period like cramps, and I freeze in a house set on 73 in summer time.I'm seem extra ill with loved ones, losing my temper, having a worse temper than before.

column2: gblass, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have experienced immediate weight gain,sore joints rash and depression since starting this medication....the side effects far out weigh the benefits...no more pills for me

column2: Kmejia0795, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm 36 years old. I have been going through menopause for 4 years now. I'm happy to FINALLY be able to take something to relieve my symptoms but I am very nervous about the side effects. We shall see - I will hate it if I gain weight and have problems with my vision.

column2: fat, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Prempro did relieve my night sweats and hot flashes but I have developed BRVO. I am very depressed and look six months pregnant. I am taking the lowest dose and will start taking it every other day until I find something better.

column2: patty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can only comment on day 4 of use.  I feel amazing!  Anger, moody, hot flashes, brain fog, headaches, body aches and pains,  ALL GONE !  Thank goodness cause I thought I was out of my mind.  Granted it may be a placebo effect at this time, but I don't care.

column2: tls, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm only on day 4 but weirdly, already feel more energy and maybe a few less hot flashes. I was worried about all the negative reviews but thought I would try it for a month. Fingers crossed!

column2: beno, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: low dose prempro stops hotflashes night sweating et insomnia

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: The treatment was given to me because I stopped my period when I was forty-two years old.  I am now sixty-nine years old, but I am taking a lower dosage.  I also have a small frame body, another reason for taking it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the medication appears to be working, but it is turning my skin even darker. I look like one half of my face is two shades darker..

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After being on the lowest dose of Prempro for 2 months, my blood pressure has dropped way too low. It's averaging 91/56 and I feel  terrible. Exhaustion is the biggest facture. I simply cannot move. I have no idea if the Prempro is causing this but I will be going off of it now.  If my bp corrects itself I will know why. I am 59 years old, 5'1" and weigh 125 so my weight is not a factor.

column2: Jude, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am 65 yrs. old.  Have been taking  Prempro for approx. 12- 15 yrs. and hope to continue forever.  I look and feel great.  No side effects that I'm aware of.My Dr. encourages me to stop taking, but I keep telling her, "why fix something that isn't broken".  I started out on the highest dose and 3 or 4 yrs ago switched to the lowest dosage.  I have no history of breast cancer in my family, it's kept my bones strong and skin looking good, no weight gain (I'm 5'6, 140 lbs.)  I'm a believer, that our bodies need estrogen at this age. I have researched alot and have found many articles as to the advantages of HRT.  That old study was done incorrectly.  I'll take my chances.  At the time the study was done 1 out of 100 women got cancer.  Small %.  However, it may be right for me (good genes) and not for someone else.  I have yearly checkups, important to do.  Good luck ladies. and God's blessings be about you.  (:

column2: BckPainRelief, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 45 years old, went thru menopause at 41 - haven't had a period in 3 years not even spotting...after 11 days of Prempro I am bleeding like having a period for the first time...called Dr. said perfectly normal...ok well hopefully this will end soon...I also have chronic back pain but controlled w/pain meds - however, for the past week my back has been hurting so bad nothing is helping, not even my pain medication...in trying to figure out why I am in such excruciating pain...it hit me Prempro is the only thing different I'm doing...so after 14 pills I will NOT put another one in my mouth....if this is the culprit, I should know soon.  Has anyone else experienced severe back pain?   I mean it is 2 a.m. and I had to get out of bed b/c I am hurting so bad I can't sleep...

column2: Nell, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Has worked for me ive been using for a couple of yrs now. My concerns now r spotting every couple of months & blurry vison & now jaw sorness w/ ear ringing & dizzy every now & then I will b looking for something else in neer future.

column2: mushavprem, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I don't know why doctors would deprive us from taking prempro.  I've had very good results from taking it.  It kept me active, free from hotflashes and other menopausal symptoms.  I helped me look young and feel young.  Once my doctor stopped me from taking it, all the symptoms came back including vaginal dryness, depression, and feeling like life was sucked out of me.  I'd like very much to continue taking the pills.  Please let the doctors know that the study done which claim it can cause cancer is flawed according to Dr. James Dobson.  The study used women in their 60's and they already had a variety of medical problems. He claimed the women on prempro should never be deprived from taking. them.  I want my prempro back!

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: CgWife04, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm going on 3 months on this. I'm only 29 but have been through Lupron twice, left me with VT and just had a hyster. This has helped with my mood swings, sleep, and hot flashes but not so much on the vaginal symptoms. I am hopeful though. Worth a try!

column2: whippey17, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am turning 50 this year and have been in peri-menapause for 5 years.  I had a blood test 1 month ago and have been verified that I am in menopause.  My Doctor put me on Prempro 1 month ago.  After the first 3 days of taking Prempro my irritability and HOT FLASHES are gone.  I would suffer terribly at work and at night.   However, I just came from an ultrasound after experiencing severe bloat and pain in my abdomen for 10 days.  They checked my liver, gallbladder, kidney and pancreas.  I have been experiencing 4 days of constipation and after taking 2 doses of myrolax a day on top of upping my Prilosec 2 times a day, I am still having extreme abdomen and esophogus issues.  I was put on an anti-spasm medication which doesn't seem to be helping.  I have been experiencing left sided chest, arm and leg pain.  I have been on weight watchers and exercise vigorously only to gain more weight.  I look, yes, 8 months pregnant and have gone from a size 10 to size 16 in about 1 month.  Yes, the sweats are gone but sleeping is an issue.  I have developed migraines everyday, all day.  Haven't had them in 4 years. I also started bleeding after 1 year of not having my period. My eyes are blurry and watery.   At this point, I feel extremely sick to my stomach and getting off this pill. Going to try Dr. Oz' menopausal smoothie and going to the Herbal Emporium for a natural remedy. There has to be a better way!!!  Thanks for all of your comments lady, you've help me tremendously in making up my mind.  I'll keep you posted as to the difference of being off this pill.  Good luck.

column2: Elaine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Started taking this drug for hot flashes and it worked great, however, over time developed optical migraines - was having 2 to 4 per week. Doctor could not explain reason for migraines.  Then started having mini-strokes.  Stopped Prempro and immediately stopped having optical migraines and strokes.  Hot flashes returned, however.

column2: Jessica, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: RAPID weight gain...almost 10 pounds in two weeks.  I have a VSG and I eat super healthy and exercise regularly--as in 4 mile runs, three times a week.  Breast swelling, nipple sensitivity, extreme mood swings, tightness in fingers, hands and face.  I HATE this medication and told my caretaker via email tonight that I'm done. I'd rather have the hot flashes.

column2: naturgrrl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I hope I can take this drug forever! My quality of life drastically improved after I started taking it 3 years ago. I couldn't sleep due to drenching night sweats and my mood was beyond irritable--my husband had to explain to my 10 year old what menopause did to women. I had no side effects and since I was sleeping and feeling more positive I've been able to stay on my exercise regimen, add new physical activities, lose 15 lbs. and continue to work full time and raise 2 kids. I'm not ready to old yet at 54 and my sex life has been amazing!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I started having hot flashes about 3-years ago and found it very difficult to sleep or even enjoy a normal day.  I started on Prempro and have found it to great.  Really works for me.

column2: sbhj, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I began taking prempro 2 years ago and stopped after a few months because I became very worried about all the possible side effects (which I wasn't experiencing).  The hot flashes and anxiety came back with a vengence so after 3 months off, I went back on and all symptoms are gone.  I wish I could take a safer drug but had no luck with the natural remedies recommended by doctors.  I hope I don't have to take Prempro long because it worries me still but gee, what a relief to be able to function again.

column2: grannyg, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I just want to know if there are any symptoms when you quit taking prempro

column2: LidiaMarie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My hot flashes and night sweats have disappeared.  I started prempro four weeks ago.  It took a total of 4 or 5 days until I started feeling relief.  This drug has been a true blessing for me.  The first time I woke up with a full night of sleep...I couldn't believe it.  I've had a small bit of spotting but that's the only side effect I have.  I sure hope that doesn't change.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Cecilia, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I feel so bad for those women who this drug has not helped.  I was so skeptical in using this because I prefer 'natural' medicine over drugs, but the herbs and supplements were no longer helping. My familty docotor actually prescribed these. He suggested if I was leary about all the side-effects, I should continue with my routine check-ups (mammo, pap smear, blood work, etc.)which I do yearly to check for any abnormalitis.  He also told me, 'Why are you suffering and more than likely making other's suffer as well'.  He was right.  I have been taking this for 3 months and it has helped with my hot flashes tremendously and mood swings! Although vaginal dryness has never been an issue, my libido has been out the door for quite a while now.  (I feel sorry for my husband, but I'm still trying!) My ob/gyn has prescripbed Estratest and am going to start that after a week or so of being off of Prempro. I saw alot of reviews that this helped with hot flashes as well as libido. (I really need both!) Will see how it goes.  If I have any major side effects, I will not continue with it Estratest.

column2: PHOENIX, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am 72, have been on this since 1993, it has releived hot flashes, climbing the wall feeling, mood swings and helped with osteopenia.  I feel "normal" when on it, when off I revert to having hot flashes, inability to sleep and terrible mood swings.  My doctor wants me to take an antidepressant after reading the side affects, I will stay with what I know my body responds positively to.  This has been a big help with libido, in case I did not mention that!

column2: Heshie101, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Prempro since early June 2011. It was prescribed by my Dr. for severe HOT flashes and all the other complications of "the change".  The HOT flashes were taking control of what little life I had.  Within a wk I had my first cycle in years. I have a yeast infection that won't go away, and as of the last two wks can't get out of bed due to fatigue, severe nausea AND stomach pain.  My throat has been raw for weeks, I have put on several pounds while dieting and now I have to look up this BRVO because my eyes have been bothering me as of late and I never made a connection to the prempro.  For those prempro helps, God bless you.  As for me, I stopped taking it after discussing symptoms with my pharmacist after missing a dose and feeling better.  I have an apptmnt with my doctor this week to do some damage control.

column2: on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I am 58 and have not had a cycle in years. I started taking this 1 week ago. I am starting to feel somewhat depressed and I dont like that. I noticed in my face and ankles also that I am retaining water. My vaginal dryness is going away though. That is the plus I see in taking this prescription.

column2: Caroline, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just starting to take the lowest dose 0.3/1.5 yesterday. Have had no period for 2 yrs. My quality of life has suffered due to bouts of hot flashes throughout the day and night as well as little to no sleep! Zero for libido! Spoke to Doc and have agreed to start this. We'll see..but am not liking the posts about side effects..glad there are these posts to read so I can be on the look out!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After taking this drug for 3 weeks, my eyes got very red and weepy, sort of like allergies.  After 5 different dr. visits (they treated me with antibiotic drops and steroid drops), I read a previous review that said the prempro gave her BRVO in her eyes.  I stopped taking the drug and the eyes started clearing up immediately.  I suffered with my eyes for 3 months before i finally figured out the prolem.  Ladies, your eyes are at risk.

column2: miriah,  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It makes me gain weight

column2: beadonna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was constantly experiencing hot flashes and night sweats.  I am 52 and haven't had a cycle in 2 years.  The hot flashes have recently picked up to where I couldn't work comfortably.  My doctor recommended Prempro .45 and I started to feel relief right after I started the medication.  I have been on Prempro for 6 weeks now and have started spotting with a few indications of a possible period coming on..?  I am not so excited about this aspect and have a call in to my doctor to check and see how long to expect this side effect to last.  I am not encouraged by the other reviews I have read in regard to this particular side effect.

column2: daiseydash, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm 45 and have been in menopause for about 5 years already.  I thought I was going crazy because people said I was to young for this!  But the blood work showed different.  My biggest problem was hot flahes and vaginal inflammation and dryness.  I wasted so much time suffering with these symptons.  I have been on Prempro for 4 months and it has changed everything.  I do not have any side effects as of yet, I was worried about weight gain but except for your normal over the winter blues pounds I have not put any extra on.  Its really been a blessing for me!  ;)

column2: bg53, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it has been good for me because my energy levels are great and I don't have to take anything for depression! aside from the skin itching its great.

column2: Stacey106a, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Prempro greatly reduced my night sweats and hot flashes.  My sleep did not improve, infact, it worsened - I probably would have been ok with the sleep thing till I was diagnosed with BRVO in my left eye due to the use of this drug...had to stop taking it...I kinda like seeing the world...Now I'm back to my old hot sweaty self..except my left eye still hasn't completely cleared up yet....

column2: concernedhotflashes, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is day one for takeing this med. I was on the patch and it worked well but was advised to come off and everything was going well. I thought wow the war of female issues are finally coming to a close. Now, I can work on the weight, memory...some joint discomfortfinally life is good...until about 2 weeks ago. The HOT came back with a vengance. Evert bone in my body aches...So, I poped the pill thinking that this was simular to the patch before I read the reviews and the side effects are disturbing. Not sure if the effects outway the relief. I cannot image being on this for yrs....? When does it stop? I have hot hot flashes, night sweats, headaches, weight is off the chart and joint painyou would not believe... How can this be better? Looking for answers.

column2: taco girl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: severe hot flashes 20-30 times a day, now after taking the medication for 7 days, zero hot flashes !!! definetly worth any risk.

column2: ckintc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hot flashes and night sweats were up to 20 to 30 a day.  I've been on Prempro .3MG/1.5MG a day for 5 weeks now.  Hot flashes are just about gone, maybe one a day.  Sleeping is not too much better other than the night sweats are gone.  Mood is greatly impoved.  Acne is a bit increased.  Stomach is gassy and bloated more than usual, but I have a very sensitive stomach.  Eye twitches more than usual, from what I have read others have had this issue.  Going to cut back to one pill every other day and wean myself off. Don't want to be on this more than necessary.

column2: Bloated , 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hot flashes and night sweats have calmed down quite a bit.  Still wish I could sleep better.  What I don't like is I instantly gained 5 pounds and that's with watching everything I put in my mouth.  Just started my second month and not all that impressed.

column2: Jen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 7th day on Prempro.  Slight decrease in frequency of hot flashes but they seem more intense when they happen.  Headache since starting medication which IS relieved with Advil.  Going to keep taking it - hopeful!

column2: carolo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on low dose Prempro for 6 weeks now.  My gyn and I decided to give it a try due to constant hot flashes, primarily. The first couple of weeks were fine.  Hot flashes completely went away.  In the past month, however, I have gained 5 pounds, have had stomach issues (bloating, gas, reflux)and dizziness that is uncomfortable and daily. My migraines have returned with a vengeance and I have had a full blown period twice this month. I came to this site to read about other's experiences and will be discontinuing the Prempro and calling my doctor.  I am considering trying Black Cohosh in small doses to see if that helps the hot flashes. I never was able to handle BCP, either, so I'm not terribly surprised that these hormones aren't agreeing with my body, either.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: Lisa T., 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went on Prempro because of vaginal dryness & irritation and lack of libido. I have had hot flashes and night sweats, but they weren't the most aggravating symptoms. I had only had a few days of "light spotting" over the last 6 months and my periods had pretty much stopped. Since I began taking Prempro a little over 3 weeks ago I really didn't notice any change in my sexual drive, but I'd only been on it a short while. However, during week 4, I started feeling nauseous and having headaches. Day 4 of week three I started having SEVERE menstral cramps and started flowing heavily. If this is what it takes to have more sex drive, I'll pass.

column2: tisherself4, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 48 years old and have suffered with hot flashes, night sweats, lack of sleep, low libido, moody etc for 4 and 1/2 years.  I tried everything including bioidentical htr .  my obgyn has been recommending prempro for some time so I gave in.  After 3 weeks no hot flashes, slept through the night and because of that more energy and can wear sweaters in the winter without feel embarrased from sweating.  I am now on my second month and the only downside right now is I have gotten my period twice.  only for 5 days each time and I hope it may subside and even if it doesn't I am staying on it.  My like has turned around.  I love sex again and my life.  That is all I can say about this product.  Thank you and I hope this helps someone else.

column2: Susan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Since taking this medicine I have been experiencing sore joints and my legs are very achey. Is this a side effect?

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: have been on the medication for a week and have not seen any relief in hot flashes/night sweats.  Work out 3-4 times a week and DO NOT want to gain weight.  Frustrated at the moment about the reviews of this drug

column2: AMJAGGER, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I AM SO GLAD I WENT TO  THIS SITE.  I HAVE  GAINED  20 LBS  ( MOSTLY IN MY MID SECTION)  PREMPRO HAS HELPED 110 % WITH  THE HOT FLASHES  ON A SCALE  OF  1-10 I AM A 10 PLUS , BUT  THE  WEIGHT  GAIN IS BAD . I DID NOT KNOW THAT  IT COULD BE CAUSED BY PREMPRO.

column2: Elaine, 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have had an upset stomach for over a week.  Alka Selser helps, but...I had a full blown period for a week, complete with pimples.  The hot flashes did dimish.  Not completely.  I would like my life back.

column2: Marie, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I've had ERT via Prempro for 20 years.  I'm currently on the lowest dosage.  I did feel a certain loss of that "sense of well-being" when I began taking the lower prescription, but I've adjusted and continue to remain very active.  I gained 5 lbs., but could use it anyway.  The benefits have certainly out-weighed the negative for me.

column2: hair, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Has helped with sleep and hot flashes, was very bad till i started this med take a low dose and half if cause to much gave me a headach. want be on but maybe a year breast cancer runs in my family.

column2: srab44, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am 66 years old and have been on HT since I was 42. I started on Premarin and a few years ago on Prempro. I have tried several times to get off, but I feel so sick,hot flashes, night sweats, loss of sleep, itching of the scalp,hair loss. I had cortisone shots and surgery of right shoulder and it interacted with my Prempro big time.The only problem is the dosage.The smallest is not enough and .45 is too much so I have to cut it in halve. It takes at least 3 months to make you feel better,you will feel side effects,but they will go away. My advice is start small dosage and patience, lot of it.You don't need sleeping pills or antidepressant drugs. Also helps with alertness.I am very happy,I take one other prescription(Lisinopril)for Blood Pressure.

column2: Jet, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking prempro about two years ago.  I had problem sleeping, night swets, and other symptoms of menapause.  This prescription has helped, and I have checkups every year, both pap and mamogram.

column2: Bonnie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Prempro has eased up my hot flashes and i have had them for years.  Although i have only been taking them for 3 weeks now, i have had some spotting.  Going to put in a call to the doctor and find out if that is a normal side effect.  Does anyone have spotting when you started to take this drug?

column2: TIRED, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: Within a couple of days of taking the med, I noticed my heart racing and developed terrible insomnia...no matter how tired, I couldn't fall asleep.  Then I started itching like crazy and have to say notice no help with the hot flashes.  I wish that my doc had given me samples prior to my buying the meds--thank goodness I didn't get the 90 day mail order script as I am NOT taking them any more.  I slept better before taking Prempro.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: wirewick, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have weakness in left hand tremors and hand does't work

column2: Roseville CA, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 60 yo, and happy to be back on Prempro.  Too it 14 years ago for 5 years prior to the WHI study then stopped.  Shifted to Lexipro antidepressant to help hot flashes and mood.  Lexipro is a terribly addictive drug and it took me 6 months to step down.  Hot flashes, loss of sleep returned with a vengence.  I had hoped that stopping the antidepressant  would rekindle my mojo and it didn't.  Saw my great diagnostician MD today and he put me back on Prempro.  I loved it then - I thought then it was an absolute miracle drug and am *so* looking forward to being back on it.  Today is Day ONE!  I'll keep you posted!

column2: Becca, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I have never been so sick in my life as when I started this pill- the only thing I can say is that I do not have any night sweats, but I am dizzy,have nausea, pain in my legs and can not eat- I have been on it for 2 weeks and my doctor now tells me to cut the pill in half. I hope that will help- I started this pill for the night sweats and the panic attacks, I have had 3 panic attacks since being on this! I will give this pill another week by taking half of it, if I have another panic attack though, I am throwing the medication in the trash!!

column2: KAT, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on prempro for 3 weeks. For the most part hot flashes are gone.  However, week 3 got my period, which I have not had for over a year.  Also I am feeling bloated and irritable.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took my first dose of this medication this morning (hence the rating at this time).  I was reluctantly prescribed this med by my primary Dr. with an explanation of the possible side effects.  He referred me to an OB-GYNE and she agreeded that there are possible serious involved with the drug, so I threw it in the trash can in her office.  However, my symptons have become unbearable so I went back to my Dr. and we decided I would take the Prempro for a short period of time with a followup office visit in 2 months.

column1: Wasting of Tissues of the Vulva
column2: Pillar40@aol.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to fight for HRP, but I am, for the most paet glad I did.I have been on it for three weeks and have had some side efects that I will report.I had some head-aches, but can't recall if they began before or after starting treatment and yesterday I had a brown spot on my panties-which seemed normal because I felt like i was getting my period.On the upside my vagina is moist again and the vulva is not flat and dry.My skin is thickening and it has stopped the terrible accelerated aging I was xperiencing.

column2: Echo, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been using Prempro .3/1.5 for 4 months.  Hot flashes are gone and I'm less irritable.  I've also been using Ambien for sleep, so it is going well.  No weight gain, no bleeding, however, behind my knees are sore.  I'm still hoping for a greater improvement in libdo, attitude, etc, so will be trying the .45/1.5 dosage next.  I'll let you know.....

column2: sh64, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have only been on this medication for about 2 weeks and the hotflashes and anxiety have calm down a lot.Sometimes I may get a minor hotflash if I am in a hot closed in area, but I feel great.

column2: rickey, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Please do not take this drug if you can possibly avoid it Sure I had no hot flashes or nite sweats whatI DID have was a Pulmomnary embolism that could have killed me I wish someone had told me this was a risk factor Relief from hot flashes is not worth dying

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: The hot flashes have stopped and I sleep better(but not good) Have leg cramps at night. Has anyone else gotten acne when they started this drug? I'm 59 years old and haven't had acne in 40years. Can't think of any other reason for it to start now.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started this drug after periods ceased (except for random one per year or 18 months). Very satisfied - sleeping well, major reduction in quantity and severity of hot flashes, mood so much better.  I did gain weight soon after, but I attributed this to menapause - started weight watchers program and have lost 19.8 pounds in a little over 3 months.  Very happy person!

column2: lynn, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 65 and the hot flashes, sleeplessness, "crazy" mood swings have not let up.  Decided to try Prempro again, after being off of it for 10 years.  Not good.  The bloating and weight gain, after 10 days is unbearable. I guess it's back to the hot day and sleepless nights.  First time around didn't have these sysmtoms.

column2: connie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: No more night sweats; hot flashes are gone!

column2: rose, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have tried Prephase and Prempro for 6 weeks. I have been experiencing leg aches my leg muscles are very stiff also have twitching of the eye muscle. I am going to try something more natural.

column2: wonderful, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: 52 yrs old I was on BC pills from the age of 17, only went off slightly before 2 preg and 9 months to 1yr after giving birth 4.5 yrs apart. Was tested for menopause and was past it, I had gone off the BC pill 6 wks prior. about 1.5 (total of 2.5 mts off of BC pills) months later started having swelling, arthritis, carpal tunnel, went to neurologist told that swelling can cause carpal tunnel, went to an arthristis spec all test came back normal. He asked what was different and I told him that I went off of BC pills and symptoms started 10-12 wk later, was told that some people cannot be taken off of these, my Dr gave me prempro and within 2-3 wks symptoms were going away. I have been taking the lowest dose every other day only and it works I'm afraid to go off of this med but do not think that I can take it for life, I fell 80 yrs old without it. Would really like to know if anybody has heard of or experienced this.

column2: Jane, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: 3 weeks in and I could not be happier.I feel fantastic! I have more energy than I have had in months, I have clarity, I am not longer weepy and distressed, I am sleeping better and most importantly, I have my MIND back. I have not started getting my period back - that will probably happen after 30 days. But I just wanted to write an update!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
Jane, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Disclaimer: With the exception of 'ease of use' I have no idea yet regarding the effectiveness or satisfaction using Prempro. I just started taking it yesterday, so in an effort to be fair, I put my stars in the middle. :) I finally went to my doctor after two months of feeling like I was losing my mind. I saw a list of "34 signs of menopause" and said 'Hey! I have 30 of these!' After reading these reviews I am a bit apprehensive - especially about the weight gain. Then I noticed the age of the women remarking on their weight gain and looking '5 months pregnant' and I don't think that has anything to do with the PremPro. I am 56 and the last 2 years or so I have been putting on weight, particularly in the middle. Good look, right? And if getting my period back is a trade off for getting my mind back, I can live with that. Anyway, I will post back in a month (or sooner!) with an update.

column2: sgriffin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Prempro for 3 weeks and the hot flashes are gone!  I don't feel great though.  I stated having dizziness and feeling "foggy headed" (hard to explain) after the second week.  I have a call in to my MD to see what he says about this.

column2: Violet, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: I have been taking this drug for 10 years and it is very addictive and I can not seem to get off it.  What can I do, what is the best way to get off this drug????

column2: Early Menopause, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering from horrible hotflashes for the past 3 months and after being on Prempro for 2 days I've noticed the hotflashes have become less frequent already!  It may be too early to give a review...if things change I will update my review.  So far so good!

column2: dog, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: going thru wierd feelings dizzy, sleepy, flighty

column2: anastacha63, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: For the last few months I have been having hot flashes and inability to sleep. I would wake up in pools of sweat. My gynecologist suggested the lowest form of prempro and told me to give it a try. It has helped somewhat with the hot flashes and night sweats but it hasn't helped with other things such as libido or vaginal dryness. I started bleeding and cramping also with the drug. My doctor said this may happen but I haven't had a period since I was 45 which was a year ago. I'm thinking the symptoms outweigh the benefits. I also worry about blood clots and stroke. I am not a smoker nor do I have a family history of either disease but I do carry extra weight and this is definitely a risk factor. I have a call into my doctor for the bleeding; I will tell her I no longer want to take it since it only takes care of one of my symptoms which isn't worth the risks.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for 7 years, had a complete hysterectomty.  Medication worked with side effects such as weight gain, bloating, and water retention.  I have been off the medication for 3 weeks and it is unbearable.  Unable to sleep at night due to night sweats, hot flashes during the day.  The bloating has gone away and I have increased my physical activity.  Will be seeing my doctor to get back on medication.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: been taking it for 2 weeks,hot flashes have stoped. but can not stand the bloating,looks like i am 6 months pregnant.will not be taking it any more

column2: review prempro, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it began to help me sleep better w/in 2 days & hot flashes also were noticably less in a very short time...I could kiss my doctor!!!

column2: sabrina44, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have been on the lowest dose for about 8 months.  Hot flashes, night sweats and insomnia were relieved but I slowly started experiencing bloating and weight gain.  I look like I'm 5 months pregnant!  I can't stand it and I'm going to stop taking them.  I will cope with the hot flashes & insomnia some other way.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was having severe hot flashes.  I gained 50lbs and had no energy.  Now I rarely wake up in the middle of the night and I can enjoy sitting in a room with others.

Normalita, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Why is it that this particular drug has NO generic available?  The cost is prohibitive for me; but I feel so much better when taking it.

column2: booboo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: swelling and itching of the face.

column2: NiceAuntie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was leary taking and HRT drug but the hot flashes were ridiculous and after talking with my MD she put me on the lowest dose of Prempro. She said try it for two weeks and see if I want a script. Well, the first week- nothing. I almost gave up, then end of second week it worked like a charm. After one month I do not have any side effects, for which I am extremely grateful. I will reevaluate need with MD after 6 months but at this point I am 100% satisfied with prempro. I want an estrogen patch but I still have my uterus and MD says I have to take the combo therapy drug. See your MD for your options. But for me I am sticking with this little wonder drug. I have tried black cohosh, vitamin E, primrose oil, soy and so on and so on. Like the recommendations say, take the least effective dose for the a little while. That works for me.

column2: dls, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My biggest fear is that this valuable medication is vanishing from the market due to a silly panic reaction in the ignorant and male dominated TV news media.  Their credo: if it has anything to do with "s-e-x" work the story to death no matter how bogus it may be.  I've been on Prempro for years.  I'm told by several MDs that the reported side effects happen very early in the treatment, if at all.  The Australian study was flawed because 65% of subjects were heavy smokers, and over half were also morbidly obese.  Therefore, cardiac symptoms were in the cards for them.  Meanwhile, a good friend of mine lost part of her jawbone thanks to Fosamax.  Our bodies soon become immune to the "imitation" and health food store hormone substitutes.  So please let's not give up our only viable choice.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
lissadug123, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: Offers relief for night sweats and hot flashes, I haven't had a period in over 15 months, but after only three week of being on Prempro I started my period and I feel terrible.  I have flu like symptoms and after reading these reviews I will be calling my doctor tomorrow.

column2: lynn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Just quit Prempro 9 days ago.  Feel great.  Took Prempro fora little over 2 months.  The first month the bloating and gas were horrible. Had a headache daily for 2 weeks. Felt like crying all the time. Started to gain weight.  The second month noticed a significant amount of scalp hair loss.  Stopped taking and went to doctor who said they had never heard of scalp loss as a side effect but I found it is listed as a rare side effect.  I am in a better mood and hoping the weight will go down again and the bloating is easing up.  My daughter is a resident and was upset when she found out my doctor had prescribed Prempro.  She said the bad far out reaches the good of this drug and she would never prescribe it herself to any patient

column2: happyface, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: no more mood swing, hot flashes are better, vaginal dryness gone,  weight gain, well 3 out of 4 , not bad

column2: payne, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: at 49 i started having bad hot flashes, memory problems, overall feeling of blah.had my labs drawn and needed hormones. bio-identicals are not for me as you can become immune to them after a few years. have been on prempro for 2 weeks and feel so much better. the hot flashes are not as bad. my frame of mind is much better. my memory is getting better. will continue for now. follow up with labs and mammograms.

column2: mermaid, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Three days in :     I'm 48. 1-year free of periods at 46. Have had facial flushing more and more, and TONS of memory challenges and aphasia. Very frustrating and is affecting my job performance, = not good. Asked my dr. about HRT for memory problems and flushing. I've been on .3/.15 for 3 days but noticed tension-type headache on 2nd day. I do take Dilantin 400mg/day for epilepsy also. Today had low level headache virtually all day. However, headache went away during step aerobics class!  I'll notify my doctor. I had planned to try HRT for one month but won't get that far if headache continues!

Will be seeing my doctor in 3 weeks.

column2: Discouraged, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I was in hopes that this medication would relieve my hot flashes, vaginal dryness & sleeepless nights.  Now I am not so sure, after reading the posts I now know why my stomach is hurting so much which was not a problem before.  I have been struggling with this since I was 39 and am now 42.  Is there no hope for me!

column2: Chris, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Began menopause at 47...at 54 flashes were suddenly awful.  Begin Prempro..flashes went away in the beginning.  However bad headaches, felt terrible and skin burning began that would last for hours. Breast swelling. I stayed with it believing "I had to get through it" as my body adjusts.Do not wait..get into your doctor.  Worst decision I ever made.

column2: HomeopathyPreferred, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Prempro for 3-4 months.Only after reading the side effects on this site, did I realize how much of my ill health may be attribulated to taking this! I have gained 15 lb, but eat less (some days feel like I'm going to throw up); have stomach bloating, the breast tenderness(which left after the 3rd week) has returned with a vengance; irritable with NO libido-unable to reach climax anymore; sinus congestion & headaches (migraines are back also); dizziness/light headedness.Need I go on?I'd been blaming ALL but the breast tenderness on other things. I'd even started taking it every other day.On the off days, the tenderness was less severe.Then I would take it, & it was severe again. It is NOT helping with the few symptoms that I started taking it for.

column2: tracy1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Even though I am relieve of my hot flashes and night sweats, this medication has left me bloated and uncomfortable most of time

column2: SWEETPEA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVE NOT HAD A PREIOD IN A LONG TIME ITS BEEN ABOUT 10 YEARS THE DOCTOR GAVE PREMPRO TO TAKE BUT IT START MY PREIOD

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I began taking the lowest dose of Prempro over 2 years ago due to hot flashes and night sweats and vag. dryness.  It completly eliminated all of them.  I did have bloating and gas pretty badly at first but that become less over time.  I used Gas X when it was uncomfortable.  The slight weight gain I experienced was probably due to my over eating so I won't blame it on the Prempo.  I decided to cut back on my dosage to see what would happen so I started cutting every other day's pill in half.  No changes.  After awhile I cut all the pill in half and still no hot flashes.  I continued this for another year until I decided to try it without any pills.  I quit in Feb. and was fine until June when the hot flashes slowly came back.  They got much worse recently so my doctor put me back on the same low dose Prempro.  I've been back on now for 5 days and the hot flashes are slowly going away again but I am experiencing bad bloating and gas again.  I had forgotten about that part of it!  Since I went off the Prempro in Feb. I had lost 15 lbs.  Hopefully there won't be any weight gain which I'll monitor very closly but the bloating makes me feel like I've gained even though it doesn't show on the scale.  I've also  had a slight upset stomach at times but that will soon pass too, as I remember.  I also noticed that my brain fog seemed to lift.  There was some hair loss at first but that too cleared up and it all grew back.  Hang in there and good luck!

column2: prempro, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have only been taking this medication for 4 days

column2: sltfac, 55-64 on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Prempro creates monthly periods for me as when I took the birth control pill.  I also have all the symptoms associated with having a period.  I take the lowest dose available.

column2: tikihiti, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was having extreme sweating and heat flushes,fatigue and general malaise. My doctor prescribed prempro, the lightest dose. It does nothing, I feel worse.

column2: mickey, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Having stomach problems when I take this medication. Make me feel like I want to throw up.

column2: ECARE, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I'm presently taking Prempro with anti=seizure medication and having reactions and being treated by my primary care and gynocologist, all very scary.

column2: on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: My doctor thought that this was the best medication for my peri-menopausal symptoms, most notably the debilitating migraines that come with hormonal shifts.  Im 53 and have not had a normal period for some time.  My periods either skip a month or two or go on for a month.  I have been on Prempro for 2 ½ months and the only thing that is gone is the night sweats.  I still get headaches, although they dont seem as strong.    I will give it six months before I decide if this is the right medication or not.  My body feels like it still wants to cycle and I get bloated and have a headache but it then goes away.  Im glad for the comments here as I was sure this might be the cure-all to my woes.  I may have to go another route after I give it six months.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After about a month of Prempro I began to feel "sane" again.  The improvement of my quality of life certainly outweighed any possible long term complications.  Prempro gave me my life back!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
anonymous, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried Prempro at my dr's suggestion, switching from cyclical premarin/progesterin. Within days I felt terrible. Hot flashes and night sweats returned, I was nervous and irritable, retained water, blood pressure went up, constant spotting, felt premenstral all the time. After about two monthes of that I went back to cyclical HRT and felt MUCH better. It definately did not work for me. The inconveneince of having periods is minimal compared to the effects that Prempro caused for me.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been menopausal for over ten years.I went on HT and stayed on it for the next eight years. I then weaned off it over a years time. My hot flashes and night sweats returned but my biggest concern is my osteoporosis. I am seeing an endocrinologist for it. Also, vaginal dryness and pain during intercourse increased. I used prempro vaginal cream and that helped, but with the osteopreosis, my gyn recommended going back on prempro. It will take some time to see if it is helping in that department but it definitely helps with the common symptoms. What I REALLY don't like is the weight gain, I have gained five pounds in two months, while I have been dieting! I also broke my arm so will have to see if increasing exercise will help offset that, but after reading many of the other reviews I have my doubts-I hate the bloated stomach!

column2: prempro, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: about 5 yrs ago switched from cyclical estrogin with progesterin last two weeks of cycle. It was working for me but Dr. suggested prempro to stop having periods. Within a few days I was feeling terrible, spotting, swollen breast, hot flashes, increase in blod pressure. I was like extreme PMS without having a period to relieve it. I hated it, discontinued it and went back to old HRT, soon felt 100% better. It is not good for everyone.

column2: susue q, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I'm experiencing chest pain & increased appetite. I consulted with my OB doctor, she told me to take it every other day to see if the chest pain would go away. I'll take her advice to give it a try. But if it doesn't work, I'll stop taking it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Tried alternate medicines first with no results. Within 3 wks of HT, my severe hot flashes reduced to a mild warmth, which I can live with. Vaginal dryness is gone as well. Will try a lower dose after 6 months.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Debi Q, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took Prempro for only 22 days - 6 years ago. I had an instant reaction, swelling, tender breasts, shortness of breath, rapid heart rate. I have gained over 35 pounds and I hardly eat. I have gone from a C to DDD cup and I am constantly bloated. Never had a tummy! My bowels are irregular and I am very sensitive to spicy foods now. It has been a horrible experience. It's not worth all the side effects. I actually feel like my body "thinks" I am pregnant. At 53, I am still searching for an answer, but I know Prempro threw my whole chemistry off! Whatever I do, I cannot lose weight-not even exercising.

column2: Kate, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: I began taking PRempro when I was 49 y.o.and felt great. It stopped my hotflashes and night sweats. FINALLY, I was able to sleep again. Due to all the negative reports, at 55 I talked my Dr. into taking me off of HRT.  I did not sleep for the next year and in general,  felt bad physically. I started Prempro again at age 56 and have been on it for the past year. I feel great, again. No hotflashes, nightsweats interrupt my sleep at night. I gained 7 lbs., but increased my workouts and have since lost the weight..plus some! I feel so much better with the Prempro that I am willing to accept any perceived health liablities.

column2: sunshine, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Lynne, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: This medication is very effective in my case. It actually took the symtoms away but it made me gain weight.

column2: swells, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Switched to Prempro from other HRT and have used Prempro about 1 year. Now having spotting - have gone to OB/GYN and testing. Until reading on this website didn't realize I was not only one fighting the weight gain and inability to lose! Have beaten myself up about weight, walked, exercised, ate lots less and still only minimal loss... now I see that it's not just my habits, it could be the Prempro. May be looking to change even though it has helped menopausal symptoms like flashes... I hate the bloated, sore boobs symptoms, not to mention the extra weight - about 10 extra pounds.

column2: Denise, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Prempro .3/1.5 for one year.  It has alleviated most of my extreme insomnia and hot flashes, but at a cost.  I have gained some weight, but mostly my breasts are very swollen and very tender, and my abdomen is also swollen so that I look slightly pregnant.  These symptoms have increased over the one year time, and the swelling is very noticeable. I talked with my doctor just yesterday and he scoffed at my symptoms and hinted that I was not getting enough exercise.  However, I also feel much better with my arthritis symptoms receding, I am not so achy, and general well being is better.  Of course, getting sleep for the first time in 5 years would also help one to feel better. In summary, it has greatly helped me, but at a cost and I have to weigh the benefits vs. the side effects.  Not getting enough sleep is so detrimental to overall health.

column2: mmk, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Have taken lowest dose Prempro for about 4 months for perimenopausal hot flashes and night sweats.  Felt truly wonderful at first, actually sleeping for the first time in months, but have since gone backwards.  No hot flashes, but back to bad sleep, swollen painful breasts (I sleep on my belly, so this is horrible), bloat, weight gain, irritability, zero libido, and never-ending heavy periods (>3 weeks of bleeding with one week between) - all very debilitating.  Will see Dr about what to do as this is utterly miserable.

column2: kitt, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: No more hot flashes, but I am a stuffed sausage with sore breasts.  And getting heavier.  It's not worth the weight gain, and not being able to pick up my grandson because of my sore boobs.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Almost 4 years post menapausal. After 1 year tried lowest dose of Prempro did not help at all so I felt it was not worth the risk. Stopped use and tried to deal with the hot flashes, using every OTC, exercise, soymilk, every trick in the book. Everything helps a little bit for a little time then on to a new remedy. The sleep disruption and flashes have become unbearable. Went to a new OBGYN, put on Prempro again at the next level dose, daytime has improved, but night time not much improvement, but what an increase in weight and still climbing at least 25 pounds, stomach bloat and the breast swelling & tenderness (yes C to D approaching DD). At only 50% improvement, and unhealthy weight I seem unable to lose -- thinking of going cold turkey again! Is there any hope, or is this what the rest of my life will be

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: carolina, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Lowest dose did not help at all 2 years ago; so I tried to deal with the flashes.  The sleep disruption and flashes have become unbearable. On again at the next level dose, daytime has improved, but night time not much improvement.  And the weight gain and unability to lose it; the breast swelling & tenderness. At only 50% improvement, thinking of going cold turkey again!

column2: MSALICE, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'M 43 YEARS OLD AND HAVE BEEN IN POST MENOPAUSE FOR 3YRS, I STARTED PREMPRO 6MONTHS AGO AND ALL MY SYMPTOMS WERE CURED, BUT THE WEIGHT GAIN IS UNBEARABLE, I WENT FROM 140 TO 185 AND WHATEVER I DO I CAN'T LOOSE WEIGHT, I WENT FROM A SIZE 7 TO A SIZE 14-16 I AM SO DEPRESSED THAT I JUST STOPPED THE PREMPRO HOPING TO DROP THE POUNDS. I WOULD RATHER HAVE HOT FLASHES THEN TO BE OVERWEIGHT AND OUT OF BREATH. AND WHO WANTS TO BUY ALL NEW CLOTHES, IT'S ALSO EMBARRASSING WHEN THE PEOPLE YOU KNOW LOOK AT YOU AND COMMENT ON YOUR WEIGHT GAIN, THERE HAS TO BE SOME ELSE ANOTHER WAY TO DEAL WITH MENOPAUSE

column2: jeaniesmth3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: No periods were great...until I started taking prempro. You never know when you are going to spot so you have to where pads everywhere you go, otherwise you would surpised.

column2: cutworks, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I don't like the weight gain, or lack of being able to lose weight, very frustratingany suggestions?I'm om the .45 dosage, and since I have started I have gained 6 pounds, and this is not good, foe one of my jobs is working for weight watchers, I was 8lbs away from my goal and now I'm 14lbs away, so I could use some suggestions, or tell me what the drug contains that makes you gain weight!I like my job and want to keep it,  please any info would be helpful

column2: lisago, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Took highest dose for 8 years.  Wound up with estrogen-receptive breast cancer (have spent one really bad year with all the associated treatment) and, of course, had to discontinue use.  And now we have evidence from studies showing increased risk.  But those 8 years were nothing short of miraculous, and if I could go back, I would not change anything but the dose.  Prempro stopped my hot flashes, gave me great energy and memory and muscle strength, stopped bone deterioration, elevated mood, and increased libido astronomically.  So net-net, it improved my life greatly. But it's best to be on the lower dose, and dont count on staying on it as long as I did.

column2: Sandie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was on prempro for more then a few years when the big scare came out.  My Doctor thought it would be better for my health to go off of this medication I tried oh how I tried...Over the counter stuff, Sarafem and I still had hot flashes and horrible night sweats.  I asked my md to please let me go back on the prempro and he did, he but me on the lowest dose and  I've been hot flash and night sweat free ever since.  There is such a thing as quailty of life.

I've been on prempro for about 4 weeks, the hot flashes have almost completely gone away. I sleep better but not 100% however after one yr of no period, I've had  period for 2 weeks now.  I have to see my gyn doctor.

column2: eja36, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have gained weight with this drug. I just lost 20 lbs and am hoping that it all doesn't come back.  I have been without my period for a year. That came back too.  The hot flashes have gone away, and I sleep better.  But don't know if I will continue if the weight keeps coming.

column9: has any one complained about weight gain

column2: jrsgal, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Overall, this medication has worked for me.  I am going through premenopause.  I have notice though that I have unexplained bruises showing up on my inner thighs and the back of my lower legs.

column2: rkrobbins, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I developed horrible face acne the 2nd month along with insomnia along with weight gain,my hair falling out and irradick blood sugars. I completed the 2nd month and did not re-order. I still have a couple of pounds to loose and the insomnia but will get that fixed.  Hot flashes have stopped and vaginal dryness will use OTC products. Loss of libido still working on.  HTT not worth it to me or maybe this was wrong one for me I don't know.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Severity of hot flashes were increasing and disrupting sleep and daytime activity. After only a few days hot flashes ceased and sleep improved, However after not having periods for 18 months I began continous spotting and very sore boobs. Time will tell if I remain on Prempro or decide to go solo.
